description: Deficit of central binomial coefficients in terms of number of prime factors: a[ n ] shows how many fewer prime factors the n-th central binomial coefficient has than n!.
comments: Primes not exceeding n/2 are missing from this kit of prime divisors. Note differences of consecutive deficits change sign like: 0,1,0,-2,0,-1,0,+2,0.
formula: a[ n ]=PrimePi[ n ]-r[ binomial[ n, Floor[ n/2 ] ] ]=r[ n! ]-r[ binomial[ n, Floor[ n/2 ] ] ]
author: _Labos Elemer_
